variance_contributors.root_cause: Unexpected main‚Äêcomponent failures (gearbox, generator, blade) drove crane mobilisation and extended downtime; lack of predictive diagnostics meant issues were detected only after failure, inflating both labour and parts costs.
Emergency call-outs required premium hourly rates and repeat crane hires; no umbrella service agreement in place, so spot pricing and duplicated mobilisation charges increased costs beyond budget.
Inventory levels were below minimum; urgent purchases at short notice attracted air-freight surcharges and rush-order mark-ups, raising average part prices and carrying costs over plan.

key_budget_priorities: Complete 5-year gearbox and blade inspections to prevent high-cost failures
Shift to predictive maintenance to cut unscheduled repair spending
Align cost/MW with industry benchmark while safeguarding availability targets
cost_saving_measures: Install continuous vibration and oil-analysis sensors on all drivetrains
Negotiate multi-year framework contracts for cranes and specialised labour
Bulk-purchase high-turnover spares jointly with neighbouring wind farms
